{{Description|Particularly fragrant flowers. They can be easily located, even in the dark, thanks to their sweet scent. Commonly used in Teyvat to make sugar.}}
'''Sweet Flowers''' are a [[Cooking Ingredient]] commonly found in the wild all over [[Teyvat]].

==How to Obtain==
Sweet Flowers grow on grassy terrains throughout Teyvat and are commonly found in all regions.

See the Video Guides section or the '''[https://webstatic-sea.mihoyo.com/app/ys-map-sea/index.html#/map/2?shown_types=160 Teyvat Interactive Map]''' for specific locations.

==Trivia==
*[[Whopperflowers]] may disguise themselves as Sweet Flowers and will attack when the player interacts with them. A disguised Whopperflower will have the {{DIcon|Talk}} icon instead of the usual hand icon.
*As of [[Version 2.3]], the only area of Teyvat where Sweet Flowers are entirely absent is [[Dragonspine]].
*Sweet Flowers have existed for a long, long time.<ref>{{Ref/Quest|Realm of Fog and Wind}}</ref>
*According to [[Xiangling]], cooking [[Silk Flower]]s and Sweet Flowers together results in an overwhelming sweetness that leaves consumers with a toothache for three days straight.<ref>HoYoLAB: [https://www.hoyolab.com/article/10270 Xiangling's official introduction]</ref>
*Sweet Flowers can be used to make [[Tunner's Cough Syrup|cough syrup]].<ref>{{Ref/Quest|Things a Father Can Do}}</ref>
*A drink called Sweet Flower Milk exists, which is apparently very sweet.<ref>YouTube: [https://youtu.be/-_1I3-J56Iw Barbara's Special Video: An Idol's Healing Magic]</ref>
*The bioalchemist [[Sucrose]] developed a keen interest in Sweet Flowers, creating almost 300 rearing plans for the plant, as well as engineering a number of unique new strains.<ref>{{Ref/CS|Sucrose|1}}</ref> She also makes confectionery from the plant's nectar to keep her blood sugar levels optimal.<ref>{{Ref/VO|Sucrose|Favorite Food}}</ref>
*The Traveler could choose to offer a Sweet Flower as their Windblume of choice during [[Invitation of Windblume]].
